basics.name: Darrius Dacquel
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm currently pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science with a Minor in Japanese at the University of Hawaii, graduating in Spring 2025. My passion lies in solving problems through code, whether it's optimizing algorithms, designing interactive user experiences, or developing creative solutions for research. Outside of academics, I enjoy video editing, weight lifting, cooking, gaming, and practicing piano—it keeps life as balanced as my code!

skills.name: Software & Design Tools
keywords: Adobe Creative Cloud (Photoshop, Premiere Pro, Illustrator, InDesign)

education.area: Computer Science w/ Minor in Japanese

work.summary: Optimizing data and redefining what's possible in research, one HashMap at a time.
highlights: Optimized strain analysis calculations by 99% by replacing a 2D array search O(n) with a HashMap lookup O(1).
Co-authoring a research paper under the guidance of a professor with 1,000+ citations.
Applied machine learning techniques for a tight-binding model, enhancing research accuracy.

work.summary: Digitizing archives and organizing events—basically a librarian superhero.
highlights: Digitized archival records, improving document preservation and accessibility by 100%.
Planned and executed special projects, events, displays, and workshops, increasing community engagement.

projects.name: UHT Task Manager
projects.description: Developed a full-stack task management application for Ulu High Tech (UHT) using React and ASP.NET Core, accelerating project delivery by 40%. Designed RESTful APIs and integrated PostgreSQL for efficient data storage and retrieval.

projects.name: Lost and Found Website
projects.description: Collaborated with a team to develop a comprehensive lost and found management website for UH Manoa using agile methodologies. Enhanced UI/UX with dynamic features, raising user satisfaction scores by 10%.

projects.name: Dreamworld Game
projects.description: Developed a Unity-based game featuring a unique gravity-flipping mechanic, achieving 100% compatibility across devices by deploying it online. Led the coding and debugging process for improved gameplay fluidity.
